intro: Calymella squamosissima, commonly known as the scaly calymella, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically oval to lance-shaped with a distinctive scaly texture on the underside. Calymella squamosissima is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
